description: South African political parties that last week agreed to form a governing alliance are limbering up for a tussle over cabinet positions, as President Cyril Ramaphosa prepares to be sworn in for a new term.
title: South Africa’s New Government Partners Poised for Cabinet Battle

description: Brazilian oil giant Petrobras agreed to pay 19.8 billion reais ($3.49 billion) in back taxes to the federal government at a time when President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is seeking increased revenue to help balance the budget.
title: Petrobras Greenlights Tax Payment That Helps Lula’s Budget

description: If Donald Trump returns to the White House, he should sever all economic ties with China, consider deploying the entire US Marine Corps to Asia and resume live nuclear-weapons testing, his former national security adviser writes in an article offering the most detailed account of what foreign policy may look like in a second Trump term.
title: Ex-Trump Adviser Urges Him to Cut Ties With China, Restart Nuclear Tests

description: European Union leaders postponed a deal on how to divide the bloc’s top jobs — opening the door to further bargaining before a summit next week.
title: EU Leaders Delay Top-Jobs Deal Before Summit Next Week

description: Labour plans to create 350 new banking “hubs” across the UK in the next five years in an effort to reverse the decline in face-to-face services if it wins next month’s general election.
title: Labour Pledges Banking Hubs to Restore Face-to-Face Services

description: The number of migrants crossing the US-Mexico border has fallen since President Joe Biden’s move to restrict asylum claims, Homeland Security Secretary Alejandro Mayorkas said.
title: Border Crossings Fell Materially Since Biden Plan, Mayorkas Says

description: Leaders of France’s left-wing parties, which have papered over deep-rooted differences to form a bloc to fight in the country’s snap legislative elections, called for unity in their first campaign rally on Monday evening.
title: France’s Left Bloc Starts Campaign With Rally Calling for Unity

description: Former Thai leader Thaksin Shinawatra is set to be formally indicted in a royal defamation charge Tuesday while a court weighs a petition to disqualify Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin — two high profile cases that threaten to plunge the Southeast Asian nation into political turmoil.
title: Thaksin Set for Indictment as Court Weighs Thai Premier’s Future

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional correspondent Erik Wasson looks at the cost estimates of Donald Trump’s proposals on tariffs and taxes. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Tallying the Cost of Trump’s Tariff and Tax Plans

description: The Biden administration sees increased foreign terrorist threats to the US compared to a year ago, thanks to renewed efforts by the Islamic State militant group and Middle East unrest tied to the Israel-Hamas war.
title: Mayorkas Detects Uptick in Foreign Terrorist Threats to US

description: The Eric Ciotti wing of the French Republican party, which has formed a pact with the far-right National Rally, will field just 62 candidates in the first round of the French legislative elections.
title: French Republicans’ Ciotti Wing to Field 62 Candidates in Vote

description: President Gustavo Petro’s flagship plan to boost state control over Colombian pensions is likely to be killed by the nation’s top court, according to constitutional experts who spoke with Bloomberg.
title: Colombian Judges Likely to Kill Leftist Leader’s Pension Reform

description: Increasingly cordial ties between Russia and North Korea should serve to refocus global attention on a peninsula that remains as dangerous as ever.
title: Worry More About Putin’s Visit Than Kim’s Dung Balloons

description: The Labour Party pledged to set up a new football regulator and said it may regulate ticket sales and review proposals to impose a transfer levy on Premier League football clubs if it wins next month’s general election.
title: Labour Vows to Set Up UK Football Regulator; Eyes Transfer Levy

description: France’s political turmoil is causing concern in some European Union capitals that initiatives like joint military spending and a fresh push to support Ukraine could fall by the wayside.
title: Macron’s Struggles Have Europe Fretting Over Defense and Ukraine

description: One of the world’s most unpopular presidents is losing support among a powerful constituency: the chief executives of Peru’s largest companies.
title: CEO Support for Peru President Plunges to 12% From 71% in a Year

description: Democratic power broker and southern New Jersey insurance businessman George Norcross was indicted Monday in an alleged tax incentive development scheme.
title: NJ Political Kingmaker Norcross Indicted on Racketeering Charges

description: Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad said he had a productive meeting with President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Monday regarding the crucial evolution of public expenditures and tax waivers.
title: Brazil Finance Minister Haddad Says Lula Meeting Touched on Balancing Budget

description: Banks and asset managers including HSBC Holdings Plc and BlackRock Inc. are helping finalize proposals for UK housing and energy policy that could form key planks of the Labour Party’s growth agenda if it wins next month’s general election.
title: Labour Taps HSBC, BlackRock for Policies on UK Housing, Energy

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally is in the lead less than two weeks away from the first round of France’s snap legislative election, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Bloomberg French Poll of Polls: Le Pen’s Far Right Is in Front

description: Canada’s government will buy stockpiled rare earth materials from Vital Metals Ltd. in a deal that prevents the company from selling its production to a Chinese buyer.
title: Canada Blocks Chinese Rare Earths Deal in Trudeau-Led Crackdown

description: US prosecutors are accusing an agent of India’s government of directing a plot to assassinate a US citizen of Sikh faith who sought an independent Sikh state. That plot, in New York, was thwarted. But around the same time, an associate of the would-be victim was killed in British Columbia, prompting a public accusation of India’s involvement by Prime Minister Justin Trudeau of Canada and vigorous denials from India.
title: Who Are the Sikh Separatists India Is Accused of Plotting Against?

description: The US Navy is boosting its deployment of artificial intelligence that automatically detect targets after successfully testing it on underwater drones, according to defense officials.
title: AI-Equipped Underwater Drones Helping US Navy Scan for Threats

description: A group of wealthy Caribbean nations is trying to shake up global finance in a way that would cut dependence on China and boost their access to funding.
title: Tourist-Rich Islands Eschew GDP as Metric to Win Access to Aid

description: Marine Le Pen’s far-right National Rally would garner 33% support in the first round of the French legislative election, while an alliance of left-wing parties would get 28%, according to a poll of voting intentions published on Monday.
title: French Leftist Alliance Edges Closer to Le Pen in Election Poll

description: Angola, which is trying to avoid being added to a global illicit-finance watchlist, said there’s a “high risk” of money laundering in the oil-producing nation’s banking industry.
title: Oil-Rich Angola Sees High Risk of Money Laundering for Its Banks

description: The US military is unlikely to deliver its first hypersonic weapons in enough quantities to be combat-ready until the fiscal year that begins Oct. 1, a congressional audit found, adding to the delay in deploying the next-generation missiles already fielded by China and Russia.
title: US Army’s New Hypersonic Weapon Is Still Months Away, GAO Says

description: A French business lobby said the approaching snap legislative elections are crucial for the economic future of the country and called for openness and stability.
title: French Lobby Calls for Budgetary Responsibility Before Elections

description: President Vladimir Putin dismissed four deputy defense ministers and appointed two people with close ties to the Kremlin elite as he continued a shake-up of Russia’s wartime leadership.
title: Putin Expands Defense Shuffle, Appoints Allies From Inner Circle

description: It lacks a single seat in Parliament, yet Reform UK will arguably pose as much a threat to the governing Conservatives as the official Labour opposition in a general election on July 4. The party’s outsize influence can be traced to its co-founder Nigel Farage, a key figure in the campaign to take Britain out of the European Union. Although the post-Brexit national renaissance he promised is yet to materialize, Farage’s pulling power endures with voters in poorer regions of the country whom the
title: Why Farage’s Party Reform UK Is Such a Threat to UK Conservatives

description: Investors are already planning portfolio changes in anticipation of the next US debt-ceiling showdown — even if it’s still more than six months away.
title: Debt-Ceiling’s Eventual Return Already Has Fund Managers On Edge

description: Maryland Governor Wes Moore pardoned more than 175,000 marijuana convictions, addressing what he said were longstanding inequities in the criminal justice system connected to the recreational drug.
title: Maryland Pardons 175,000 Weed Convictions in Juneteenth Action

description: Israel’s defense exports reached a record last year as wars including those in Ukraine and Gaza raise the specter of a global arms race.
title: Israeli Defense Exports Hit Record as Global Arms Spending Soars

description: European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said he’s concerned about the rise of the far-right across the region.
title: ECB Vice President Says ‘Personally’ Concerned by Far-Right Rise

description: The Dalai Lama isn’t thinking about his reincarnation yet, he said on Monday, adding more uncertainty over who will succeed the octogenarian monk as China pushes for sway over the future of Tibet and its leadership.
title: Dalai Lama Says He’s Not Considering Reincarnation Yet

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit North Korea and Vietnam in rare trips to long-time partners as he faces renewed challenges in his war on Ukraine.
title: Putin to Visit North Korea, Vietnam as His War in Ukraine Stalls

description: US diplomat Amos Hochstein has traveled to the Middle East in a bid to ease tensions between Israel and Hezbollah, which are threatening to spiral into a full-blown war across the Lebanese border.
title: US Envoy Flies to Israel in Bid to Calm Situation With Hezbollah

description: The government’s new authority is limited to just 10 medicines purchased by Medicare, and manufacturers may charge more for years before negotiations kick in.
title: It Will Take More Than US Bargaining Power to Cut Drug Costs

description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK party retained its record rating in Bloomberg’s poll of polls ahead of its manifesto launch on Monday as both the front-running Labour Party and Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives slipped marginally in recent days.
title: Reform UK Party Stays at Record Levels, Poll of Polls Shows

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Macron Puts Himself and France in a Tight Spot

description: Reform UK Leader Nigel Farage said he wants to establish a “bridgehead” in Parliament at the general election, with the aim of ultimately replacing the Conservatives as the main right-wing force in British politics.
title: Farage Targets ‘Bridgehead’ at UK Vote to Build Right-Wing Bloc

description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu dissolved the influential War Cabinet tasked with steering the war in Gaza, Israeli officials said Monday, a move that comes days after a key member of the body bolted the government over frustrations surrounding the Israeli leader's handling of the war.
title: Israeli Officials Say Netanyahu Has Dissolved War Cabinet, AP Reports

description: President Joe Biden’s reelection campaign is kicking off a $50 million June advertising blitz, targeting minority voters in battleground states ahead of his debate with Donald Trump next week.
title: Biden Team Unveils $50 Million Ad Campaign Tied to Trump Debate

description: European Union member states finally signed off on a controversial law to restore nature across the bloc after Austria’s climate minister backed the deal despite opposition from her boss and coalition partners.
title: EU Nature Law Passed After Austrian Minister Bucks Chancellor

description: China and South Korea will hold their first high-level security talks in about nine years, with their discussions in Seoul expected to coincide with Russian President Vladimir Putin’s first trip to North Korea since 2000.
title: China, South Korea Set for Their First Security Talks Since 2015

description: French government bonds won some respite after assurances from far-right leader Marine Le Pen that she would co-operate with President Emmanuel Macron should she prevail in upcoming national elections.
title: French Bond Rout Pauses as Traders Assess Le Pen’s Reassurances

description: The costs of the 10% minimum import duty will filter down to consumers.
title: Trump’s Planned Tariffs Will Tax US Households, Economists Warn

description: French President Emmanuel Macron’s group and its allies won’t field candidates in about 60 electoral districts so as to clear the way for other parties with a better chance of barring the road to the far right and a new leftist alliance, Prime Minister Gabriel Attal said.
title: Macron Opts Not to Field Candidates in Some 60 Districts in Vote

description: China’s Coast Guard said Chinese and Philippine vessels had a collision in waters near the Spratly Islands in the South China Sea, but Manila described Beijing’s account as “misleading.”
title: China, Philippines Spar Over Details of Latest Ship Collision

description: Russia set June 26 for the opening of an espionage trial against imprisoned Wall Street Journal reporter Evan Gershkovich, a step that may hasten negotiations for a possible swap deal.
title: Russia Set to Begin Trial of WSJ Reporter Evan Gershkovich on June 26

description: NEW DELHI (AP) — A cargo train rammed into a passenger train in India's eastern state of West Bengal on Monday, killing at least five people and injuring several others with rescue work ongoing.
title: Five Killed, Dozens Injured in India Train Collision

description: Both Labour and the Conservatives are preaching fiscal prudence ahead, with the trauma of 2022’s market rout keeping politicians in line
title: The Specter of Bond Vigilantes Looms Over UK Election Campaign

description: Donald Trump’s new proposal to exempt tips from taxation would add between $150 billion to $250 billion to the federal budget deficit over 10 years, a budget watchdog group forecast on Monday.
title: Trump Plan to Exempt Tips From Taxes Could Cost $250 Billion

description: The European Union’s 27 leaders are gathering for summit talks with French President Emmanuel Macron’s decision to call a snap parliamentary election fueling concerns of further advances for the far right.
title: EU Leaders Look to Regroup With France in Turmoil: What to Watch

description: The ruling Conservative Party let local anti-development skeptics to grow in influence over the past 14 years by choosing not to intervene in the vast majority of UK homebuilding applications.
title: Fourteen Years of Tory Rule Gave NIMBYism a Free Pass in the UK

description: UK inflation is expected to fall to the Bank of England’s target for the first time in almost three years, but the milestone may do little to help Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s beleaguered government ahead of the July 4 general election.
title: UK Inflation May Fall to 2% Target, But Too Late to Save Sunak

description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy is returning to Kyiv with €50 billion ($53.5 billion) in aid, fresh security guarantees from the US and commitments to help rebuild energy infrastructure for a country battered by more than two years of war.
title: Ukraine’s Global Outreach Hits Wall as Summit Goals Fall Short

description: China will include Australia in its visa waiver program, Premier Li Qiang announced after meeting with Prime Minister Anthony Albanese in Canberra, in the latest sign of warming relations between the two countries.
title: China to Include Australia in Visa Waiver Program, Premier Li Says

description: TAIPEI (AP) — A Chinese vessel and a Philippine supply ship collided near the disputed Spratly Islands in the South China Sea on Monday, China’s coast guard said, in the latest flare-up of escalating territorial disputes that have sparked alarm.
title: China Blames Philippine Ship for Collision With Chinese Vessel in South China Sea
